block.p: An article last Wednesday about criticism of the Food and Drug Administration's efforts to protect food safety misstated the agency's explanation for the cause of a recent contamination outbreak. It believes melamine, a chemical used in fertilizers and plastics that has tainted pet food and animal feed, was in wheat flour imported from China -- not in wheat gluten or rice protein. (The agency's initial assessment was based on the fact that the flour was mislabeled as wheat gluten or rice protein.)
